data.title: I almost don't want to review this place
data.text: It's our favorite restaurant period. It's family run with the best sushi in the United States. We are treated like royalty every time we come even with our 10 month old baby. It's a hidden gem that is one of those places that someday will be gone.

data.title: Sushi 10.0
data.text: The best hands down. I lived in Japan for 3 years. This place rivals 100% of the restaurants there. If you are truly into fresh fish and not commercialized product.

data.title: Best Sushi PERIOD
data.text: I have been all over the Nation and to many countries outside the U.S.  This  is the best and freshest fish you can buy.  If you like rolls with a ton of mayonnaise and eel sauce, this place is not for you, go to Gold Fish or Big Tuna.  If you want classic Japanise Sushi and Sashami, this is your place.  I have been a regular customer since 1989 and he opened in 1985, so I how've seen quite a bit over the years.  Remarkably, it has always been the freshest available anywhere.  If you want a trip to flavor town, try the No Name Number 3

data.title: Amazing fresh fish / sushi
data.text: Shogun has some of the freshest sea food, period! Mt wife, not a sea food person has mentioned that there is no fish smell to the restaurant, a testament to its freshness. Every meal has been fantastic and consistent over the years. My wife has found some non sea food favorites. I have had several sushi rolls and the "chef's choice" taster plate and has always been great! Not a "fast food" joint and probably not for small kids. Its is cozy, so will fill up on evenings, so go early or be patient.

data.title: Family dinner
data.text: Friendly restaurant and good food. Easy to find. Easy parking. Enjoyable family dinner just before new year. Reliable and authentic.

data.title: Freshest fish
data.text: After moving from Los Angeles to Palmdale we discovered Shogun. Masasan buys the best and freshest fish (nothing is precut or frozen). Always the best.

data.title: Superb sushi!
data.text:
We were visiting my Grandma in Palmdale and heard about Shogun on TripAdvisor, she'd never heard of them having lived here 12 years. We quickly found out what she'd been missing out on. 
The sushi here is excellent. The fish is so fresh and the rolls and nigiri are simple and delicious. The fatty tuna and albacore were particularly good, but all the food we had was amazing.
Lovely service too. Highly recommended.

data.title: Real, Authentic, Fresh Sushi
data.text: This isn't a mass produced twenty-five dollar all-you-can-eat restaurant, nor is it a swanky, over-priced, look-how-hip-I-am restaurant.  This is a real Japanese place with a genius chef.

data.title: if you ever find yourself in Palmdale, you must eat here.
data.text: Did not imagine it was possible to eat well in this area, but Shogun Sushi is a diamond in the rough. Don't be too fussy: just eat what the chef tells you to eat. Incredibly fresh fish, trusted chef, worth the money and worth the trip to Palmdale.

data.title: FRESH!
data.text:
I was in town for work and ate here 3 out of 5 nights. The fish is fresh and the technique is on point. Everything here is done with passion. 

Highly suggest!

data.title: Fresh, authentic, and great tasting sushi!
data.text: This place rocks! The fish is super fresh - making the texture the best and making the taste incredible. Let's face it, if it taste like fish, it isn't fresh. The place is very small, and it doesn't matter whether the place if full or you're the only one, the wait seems to be the same so we have found that patience is needed for this great sushi. We have come to realize when coming here that it's time to enjoy your company, sit back, drink some sake or a large beer, and enjoy it - because only one guy makes the sushi, and when it arrives, it will all be worth the wait!

data.title: Masa-san: Sushi Master
data.text: When we think of Shogun we think: best quality fish.  Masa-san hand selects only the choicest fish himself, everyday at the fish market in L.A.  This means he has to be there EARLY - no small feat from Palmdale.  He is a true master at preparation and is dedicated to his art.  If you love traditional sushi you cannot go wrong here. While other local restaurants have let us down, we've come to rely on Shogun for a consistently impeccable meal.  My husband always chooses the chirashi or the sushi supreme.  Masa-san always delights with additions of ankimo (monkfish liver), ebi (sweet shrimp), uni (sea urchin), or other surprises (only in season, of course).  I "just" get the sashimi special - a full balanced meal for a great price.  For years they accommodated our sushi-challenged child with special requests like salmon or tuna cooked rare or medium rare.  Delightful and caring staff, delicious fish, dedicated service - these all help you forget that the setting is a bit small, noisy and perhaps in need of a pick-me-up.

data.title: If you Want GREAT SUSHI come try it.
data.text: One day me and my wife was driving around looking for somewhere to eat. We found Shogun. My wife was like lets try it. Okay we went in. A lil back ground My wife love's Sushi and am not a fan of it. So my wife order some stuff and I stayed with basic. Then I saw how much my wife was enjoying it so I tried some of hers. I got to say it was not fake fish it was great and now I could see why my wife was in Heaven with it. So one day my Wife tells me about her promotion at work. So I tell her to get ready so I could take her somewhere so I toke her to Shogun. I said I will try other stuff. so Me and My wife order Different Sushi. It was so great that we have gone back many times to try different Sushi's. The chef is a Great Chef.

data.title: Japanese Chef is the Owner, ALL Entrees 6 Stars
data.text: It's hard to get the whole family to go to a Japanese place because usually they get crap food while I get Sushi.  NOT HERE!  EVERYTHING IS PERFECTION!  It's been a long time since I have been to a Japanese Restaurant that every dish was expertly prepared.  I ordered the California Roll, Yellow Tail, Halibut, and Tuna Sushi (all fresh and delicious).  Even the rice was excellent.  Most sushi rice is just regular rice with vinegar and sugar added.  I don't know what he does to this rice but it does not over power the fresh fish.  It's the first time I have eaten ALL of the rice with my sushi.  Mama and our teenager ordered the teriyaki chicken with deep fried shrimp.  Then they ordered a side of shrimp tempura.  I even had a bite of the tempura, this is hands down the best shrimp tempura I have ever had.  It was light, crispy with fresh hot shrimp in the middle. Even the service was excellent.  There was this little old Japanese lady that served us and she was very pleasant.  Mama was kind of surprised when she said not to pour soy sauce on the rice cause it insults the chef!  I just smiled. Even today we are still talking about how good the food was.  A little hard to find but well worth the effort.  This is now our stop for Japanese food and sushi within a hundred miles from home.  No where else comes close.  If you have read this far, then let me say one more thing.  I have been eating sushi all over the world for over 30 years.  I can't say that I have ever had Sushi that was any better than Shogun Sushi.  Worth it at any price.

data.title: The Best and Fresh Fish .... U get what u pay for !!!
data.text: This is the best sushi I have had in the states. Big Tuna and Tokyo Steak don't offer the same. It's worth the extra for authentic high quality Sushi

data.title: A Bit Pricey, But for a Good Reason
data.text: Very fresh and very authentic sushi.  We ahve eaten at TsuKiji Market in Tokyo and this place is just as good.  The owner drives down to the docks to buy his own fish fresh almost daily.  It's not a place tha is the easiest to find you arrive and say "really?"  After dinner, you may agree that it was worth the hunt.

data.title: Consistantly the best sushi I have ever had
data.text: We have gone to Shoguns for years now and they never fail to provide top quality sushi and service.  It is family owned and operated.  Masa drives down to LA daily and selects the best fish available for his restaurant.  Don't ask him what's good today because in his restaurant it is all good.

data.title: Hidden Sushi Gem in Palmdale, CA
data.text:
Shogun has some of the best sushi I've ever eaten.  The sushi chef/owner Masa and his wife do an amazing job.  The freshest fish and amazing preparations.  I usually leave myself in his capable hands with Omikase.  He always creates something to remember--unique and delicious.

Don't miss it.  Off the beaten path, with no frills--just excellent food and service.

data.title: Freshest Fish On The Planet.
data.text: Traditional Japanese at it's best. No crazy rolls with crazy sauces (to cover up the less then fresh fish), just straight forward fresh fish. Masa and his wife have been here for 25+ years. He goes down to L.A. every morning to personally select the fish for that days service. He can tell you what part of the world each fish came from and absolutely will not serve anything not up to his standards. Shogun is not cheap. Fresh is expensive. If you are looking for frozen fish and imitation Krab smothered in 3 kinds of sauce, prepared by sushi school chefs, DO NOT GO HERE. Go to Goldfish, Big Tuna, or Love Sushi and enjoy yourself. If you would like to treat yourself to a great meal and learn something about the fish your eating, give Shogun a try. You will not be disappointed. The worst thing that will happen is that you will become spoiled and unable to enjoy sushi of lesser quality. They also serve up some great combination dinners and  lunches with chicken, beef, cooked fish, and vegetables for diners who do not enjoy raw fish.

data.title: Like Butter
data.text:
This is old-school, fresh, Oh My Goodness it's like Butter, awesome sushi.  I've had sushi in plenty of expensive, big-city sushi places, east-coast and west-coast and in Asia, for awesome sushi and sashimi this place contends with the best I've ever had and has remained so for the ten years-or-so I've been in the Valley.

The key seems to be Sushi Chef, Masa-San.  He is always behind the counter - he must be the owner, he's quiet, friendly, and really knows sushi.  Shogun has a sushi bar that might seat six plus maybe the same abount of tables.  You'll find excellent sushi and some other very good Japanese fare served in a nice, cozy environment at a very reasonable price.  Please note you'll not find: sumo matches on television, blaring music with disco lights, teriyaki taco tiramisu or any other asian fusion, exploding live octopus roll or a bunch of other crazy rolls - not that there's anything wrong with that stuff - it's just not this guy's gig.  The decor and menu are clean and classic and that's it - and don't worry, he has some wonderful, big rolls - they just aren't moving or on fire or anything.

Make sure to call them and Google Map the place before you go - it's staff is so small it's not open 24/7 and it's tucked back from the road across Q-6 from the Hammack Activity Center in a small, unassuming looking little place with no big signs or anything.  The parking lot fits only six or seven cars in front so if it's crowded, I just park in the Activity Center parking lot and walk across the street.
